summary:
Since beginning my career in the design industry, I have thrived in companies that have given me the freedom to develop myself not only as a creative professional, but also to grow at a personal level. I believe that this is something that is important to have throughout my career. 

Through training and research, I have been able to develop my conceptual designing skills, as well as learning new tricks and techniques. Using these skills, I have created, and directed the creation of, many different campaigns in many different mediums for many different audiences.

Through travel and cultural experiences, I adapt and tweak the tricks and techniques I have learnt and apply these into my creations, adjusting as necessary to suit the targeted audience. It’s a fantastic feeling when you get it right, and it’s also quite addictive.

treasury_media.description: A short portfolio of the work I have done over the last few years. If you would like to see more then please don't hesitate to reach out.

education.field_of_study: Industrial, furniture, product and graphic design. Design technology

profile_positions.description: As Creative Lead, my role was primarily telling (and selling) a story visually. From overall concept to individual illustrations, everything I created reflects and enhances client need and Deloitte’s brand, delivering ideas which were new, unique, and compelling.
profile_positions.title: Creative Lead

profile_positions.description:
Create high value presentations within tight deadlines to be used to sell iP2 Entertainment’s multi-million-dollar facilities across the globe. Creation of multi-lingual signage, packaging and on brand collateral for use in these centres, both in print and digital form. Development of designs which were unique yet recognisable as within the same brand and product set. 
Working closely with clients such as Mattel (Barbie, Hot Wheels & Mega), National Geographic, Ducati, Real Madrid, and DreamWorks (Shrek, Trolls, How to Train Your Dragon, Kung Fu Panda, The Croods).

Skills listed:
•	Manage multiple projects on very tight deadlines
•	Prepare high value presentations on a quick turn-around 
•	Create signage and posters in multiple languages to be used in our centres all over the world
•	Design icons and illustrations that need to be to be understood in many different cultures
•	Create packaging and merchandise products
•	Manage a small team of designers to meet our deadlines
•	Design and update any other large-scale printed graphics be required in the attractions 
•	Photo manipulation and adjusting
profile_positions.title: Senior Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description:
• Direct and design for two brands of monitors with 3 distinct styles; Philips, AOC Gaming and AOC non-gaming
• Create online and offline advertisements in multiple languages for use within Europe (and Russia)
• Manage other creative agencies (designers, animators, DTP, translation, printers and PR) to ensure work meets the deadlines set and quality expected from them. 
• Develop and create many professional connections with the above agencies to help with my work flow
• Create the art for booth stands for both small and large venues. This included working on the booths for Gamescom in Cologne and IFA in Berlin (2016 and 2017)
• Assist marketing in developing campaigns and product launches
• Work with PR agencies across Europe to ensure our campaigns have the correct look and feel
• Restyle and refresh the institutional marketing tools (catalogue and trade presentations)
• Meet the demands of the sales team (around 100 people)
profile_positions.title: Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description: This position is the same as is described in the AOC Graphic designer position above
profile_positions.title: Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description:
From the creation and layout of Staples' printed catalogues to the web banners of our European web sites, I have been able to work on many different projects in this role.

Specific tasks that I have been involved with include:
• Oversee the packaging of the own brand products (creation and proofing)
• Develop style guides for new campaigns
• Catalogue cover design
• Campaign conception 
• Catalogue layout (DTP)
• Leading a small team of people in web banner creation for up to 10 countries
• Create and retouch images to promote special products and gifts
profile_positions.title: Creative Designer

profile_positions.description:
From the wide range of experience I had gained in the design industry, I was able to offer clients complete design solutions that could be also translated to web, stationery, printed and digital advertising, packaging and promotional items as necessary.

Design skills developed:
• Graphic (print and web)
• Branding (logo and house styles)
• Packaging
• Desk top publishing
• Illustration
• Client relations
profile_positions.title: Designer and Owner

profile_positions.description:
Working at Staples I was given the opportunity to be a designer in many different fields such as product, packaging, and graphic designer. I also acted as the project manager for many of the projects I was to undertake in my time here.

Listed below are some examples of what I designed for Staples:
• A range of laptop bags (lady's laptop bag, backpack, rolling cases and standard bags) 
• A range of staplers and punches
• Concepts for a more European style of shredder
• Assisted with the development of the Staples Europe brand guidelines
• Ink cartridge packaging
• POS stands, banners, flyers and a number of other items for the company.
• Promotional displays 
• Product dispensers
• Exhibition displays
• As well as more typical graphic design work such as web banners, flyers and catalogues. 

This position evolved from my previous position in Corporate Express and many of the tasks were carried over from this position (see below).
profile_positions.title: Product & Packaging Designer

profile_positions.description:
I was employed as a desk top publisher to re-do the packaging of the old Corporate Express into the new look and feel of Corporate Express. The team for this project consisted of three people, a traffic manager, the project manager and myself.  Because of the size of the team I would often work as the traffic manger as well. Before the completion of this project Staples bought the company and all work stopped until it was decided which direction would be taken in regards to the branding.

In this role I worked on the following projects:
• Re-brand own brand packaging (3 rounds, the final round included 10 languages)
• Create mock-ups of images from the old style to the new style. 
• Create the artwork for European catalogue by merging the guidelines from Corporate Express and Staples. 
• Photo retouching on products and people
• Proof work packaging art work done by European/Asian suppliers
profile_positions.title: Desktop Publisher & Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description:
• Proof and sign-off printed items on-site ensuring that they follow the clients’ strict guidelines.  
• Set up of campaigns in coordination with the campaign manager, recommending a component list for each mailing campaign.
• Monitor project timetables and maintain a strict adherence to them, suggesting a timetable to the campaign managers.
• Create a budget and reconcile marketing expenses for each campaign.
• Negotiate a better price for each component, and propose alternatives to reduce campaign costs.
profile_positions.title: Production coordinator

profile_positions.description:
• Organise and initiate promotional activities and advertising.  
• Develop original ideas to increase brand awareness.   
• Contact printer for advertising materials
• Negotiate with publishers and other agents about interesting ways to advertise in their publications.  
• Lead visual merchandiser of the shops.
• Designed the interior of three shops; Rotterdam, Maastricht and Groningen.
• Create a minimum stock level for each store based on sales, place special orders for promotions and organise merchandise transfers.
• Track performance of new and refurbished stores; follow up with additional promotional needs. 
• Manage employees: training of staff, recommend the hiring and firing of staff, resolving staff conflicts, create employee instructions and managing the roster.
profile_positions.title: Communication Manager

volunteer_experiences.description:
Click to edit position description•	Creating and redesigning a quarterly magazine, and other publications such as an information calendar, newsletters and information sheets
•	DTP of all publications, some image design and refinement of the organisation’s logo and image in general.
•	Layout and some designing of advertising in all publications. Dealing with advertisers to ensure that the correct format and size of advertisement were received, by a deadline. Develop and refine advertisements during publishing, 
•	Managing writers and other contributors as chief editor: ensure that people in my department worked to a strict deadline, and publications were released on time.
